movie_title: Dancing for the brain ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Not a dancer? You might change your mind once you hear the benefits! Beth and Neil discuss this and

vocabulary.definition: to dance energetically, especially to rock music
vocabulary.example: The party was so lively that everyone couldn't help but boogie on the dance floor.

vocabulary.definition: the act of freeing emotions, feelings, or tension from the body
vocabulary.example: Yoga provides a great release for her stress after a long day at work.

vocabulary.definition: whatever happens, even if it involves a lot of difficulty, time, or effort
vocabulary.example: She was determined to succeed at all costs, no matter what obstacles she faced.

vocabulary.definition: delays making a decision or choosing one course of action over another
vocabulary.example: He always sits on the fence when it comes to making important choices, fearing the consequences.

vocabulary.definition: a sudden jerky movement or spasm in your body, often involuntary
vocabulary.example: Her eye started to twitch nervously as she waited for the test results.

vocabulary.definition: tending to be different or develop in different directions
vocabulary.example: The group had divergent opinions on how to solve the problem, leading to a lengthy discussion.
